title: NA
text: Follow pattern existing exercises (e.g. exo_revert_file()) Use @inheritParams exo_one_small_change parent_path parameter Use @git list related git commands (generate doc links) Use @export Wrap user-facing strings tr_() translation support @git tag references new git commands, add entries R/roxygen2.R git_links() command name, display name, URL Create inst/exo_<exercise_name>-Rprofile.en.R challenge prompt tip() function Create inst/exo_<exercise_name>-Rprofile.fr.R (French translation) Create inst/exo_<exercise_name>-Rprofile.es.R (Spanish translation) Run potools::po_extract() update .pot file new tr_() strings Run potools::po_update() sync .po files updated .pot Run potools::po_compile(). Update po/R-fr.po po/R-es.po translations new strings Snapshot gert::git_log(repo = path)[["commit"]] Test relevant repo state (tags, branches, etc.) Add exo_<exercise_name> _pkgdown.yml appropriate section Add bullet NEWS.md development version heading Run devtools::document() update NAMESPACE Run tests accept new snapshots

title: saperlipopette
text: package intended companion https://ohshitgit.com/, name honour exclamation. “saperlipopette” old-fashioned French exclamation. can say “Saperlipopette, Git!”.

title: saperlipopette
text: stage, user open newly created R project launch R session, messages indicate , URL follow, find, case, corresponding ohshitgit entry. practice user change file, Git add , run git commit --amend ---edit. user examine Git history . need instructions initially provided, user can run: interface relies adding .Rprofile newly created project, instructions formatted cli package. ’ve set Git author, committer date automatic commits get hashes, can useful teaching group: everyone looking hashes machine, except commits create . use gert::git_log(), opposed git log command line, integrates better R Markdown use building documentation. saperlipopette can create messages English (default) also French Spanish. Example French:
code: library("saperlipopette") parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_one_small_change(parent_path) #> ℹ Follow along in /tmp/RtmpQOPptZ/file1c532c6eb956/one-small-change! # what's in path fs::dir_tree(path) #> /tmp/RtmpQOPptZ/file1c532c6eb956/one-small-change #> ├── R #> └── bla # with Git in a command line: git log # or the gert R package gert::git_log(repo = path) #> # A tibble: 2 × 6 #>   commit                          author time                files merge message #> * <chr>                           <chr>  <dttm>              <int> <lgl> <chr>   #> 1 2ff0d31f566e68ae0ee94b6028a3fa… Jane … 2023-12-15 15:25:00     1 FALSE "feat:… #> 2 e227ecc55e421f70b6e30602e6a2ee… Jane … 2023-12-15 15:25:00     2 FALSE "First… #> ✖ "Oh shit, I committed and immediately realized I need to make one small change!" #> ✖ I wanted to list 3 things in my bla file, not only two! #> ℹ See <https://ohshitgit.com/#change-last-commit> #> ℹ For more help use `tip()` tip() #> • Add 'thing 3' to the 'bla' file and save it. #> • `git add bla` #> • `git commit --amend --no-edit` #> • Examine Git history. parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_one_small_change(parent_path) #> ℹ Follow along in /tmp/RtmpQOPptZ/file1c531cc776aa/one-small-change! gert::git_log(repo = path) #> # A tibble: 2 × 6 #>   commit                          author time                files merge message #> * <chr>                           <chr>  <dttm>              <int> <lgl> <chr>   #> 1 2ff0d31f566e68ae0ee94b6028a3fa… Jane … 2023-12-15 15:25:00     1 FALSE "feat:… #> 2 e227ecc55e421f70b6e30602e6a2ee… Jane … 2023-12-15 15:25:00     2 FALSE "First… parent_path2 <- withr::local_tempdir() path2 <- exo_one_small_change(parent_path2) #> ℹ Follow along in /tmp/RtmpQOPptZ/file1c531df27a7f/one-small-change! gert::git_log(repo = path2) #> # A tibble: 2 × 6 #>   commit                          author time                files merge message #> * <chr>                           <chr>  <dttm>              <int> <lgl> <chr>   #> 1 2ff0d31f566e68ae0ee94b6028a3fa… Jane … 2023-12-15 15:25:00     1 FALSE "feat:… #> 2 e227ecc55e421f70b6e30602e6a2ee… Jane … 2023-12-15 15:25:00     2 FALSE "First… library("saperlipopette") withr::local_language("fr") parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_one_small_change(parent_path) #> ℹ Follow along in /tmp/RtmpQOPptZ/file1c53134d007d/one-small-change! # what's in path fs::dir_tree(path) #> /tmp/RtmpQOPptZ/file1c53134d007d/one-small-change #> ├── R #> └── bla # with Git in a command line: git log # or the gert R package gert::git_log(repo = path) #> # A tibble: 2 × 6 #>   commit                          author time                files merge message #> * <chr>                           <chr>  <dttm>              <int> <lgl> <chr>   #> 1 2ff0d31f566e68ae0ee94b6028a3fa… Jane … 2023-12-15 15:25:00     1 FALSE "feat:… #> 2 e227ecc55e421f70b6e30602e6a2ee… Jane … 2023-12-15 15:25:00     2 FALSE "First… #> ✖ "Et merde, je viens de commiter et il manque une toute petite modification !" #> ✖ Je voulais lister 3 choses dans mon fichier bla, pas seulement 2 ! #> ℹ Voir <https://ohshitgit.com/fr#modifier-le-dernier-commit> #> ℹ Pour plus d'aide, `tip()` tip() #> • Ajouter 'chose 3' au fichier 'bla' puis l'enregistrer. #> • `git add bla` #> • `git commit --amend --no-edit` #> • Examiner l'historique Git.

title: saperlipopette
text: Consult reference. Exercises cover: Oh Shit, Git!: exercises inspired https://ohshitgit.com/ Katie Sylor-Miller. Clean history: exercises get clean Git history, instance using rebase interactive. Use history: exercises use Git history, instance using blame. individual learner, pick want learn try ! instructor, can mix match exercises: instance focussing session solving common mistakes (Oh Shit, Git!) create clean Git history (exercises “Use history” exercises “Clean history”). Feel free suggest new exercises opening GitHub issue.

title: Create Example Git Messes
text: can install development version saperlipopette like , R-universe: GitHub: ’ll also need Git installation, made probably already use Git least bit. basic Git knowledge, particular able examine Git history, git log tool IDE. directory store exercises folder. examples use temporary directory prefer, use dedicated “scratch directory”.
code: install.packages(   'saperlipopette',    repos = c('https://packages.ropensci.org', 'https://cloud.r-project.org') ) # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("ropensci-training/saperlipopette")

text: notice bug codebase. can see bug bunch commits ago. Beside regular debugging, can find commit introduced bug using git bisect. See https://git-scm.com/docs/git-bisect https://www.jimhester.com/post/2019-04-24-git-bisect/.

code: exo_bisect(parent_path)
if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_bisect(parent_path = parent_path) }

text: want find added line x <- x + 1 script . tool git blame path//file.

code: exo_blame(parent_path)
if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_blame(parent_path = parent_path) }

text: exercice check Git's core.editor set correctly. https://docs.github.com/es/get-started/git-basics/associating-text-editors--git

code: exo_check_editor(parent_path)
if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_check_editor(parent_path = parent_path) }

text: debugging instance created now useless untracked files directories, need remove "manually". tool git clean: git clean -n dry run; git clean -f run ; Add -d also remove directories. See https://git-scm.com/docs/git-clean.

code: exo_clean_dir(parent_path)
if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_clean_dir(parent_path = parent_path) }
exo_committed_to_main(parent_path)

text: git reset --hard, git branch, git switch, git checkout.

code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_committed_to_main(parent_path = parent_path) }
exo_committed_to_wrong(parent_path)

text: git cherry-pick, git reset, git switch, git checkout.

code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_committed_to_wrong(parent_path = parent_path) }

text: made work feature branch want merge . Meanwhile, main branch advanced. Unfortunately someone touched file . Now need fix merge conflict! See also https://happygitwithr.com/git-branches.html#dealing--conflicts.

code: exo_conflict(parent_path)
if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_conflict(parent_path = parent_path) }
exo_latest_message(parent_path)
if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_latest_message(parent_path = parent_path) }

text: want find commit deleted script.R. tool git log --oneline -- path.

code: exo_log_deleted_file(parent_path)
if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_log_deleted_file(parent_path = parent_path) }

text: want find commit deleted line "iris" text file. tool git log -S<string> path//file git log -G<regex> path//file.

code: exo_log_deleted_line(parent_path)
if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_log_deleted_line(parent_path = parent_path) }
exo_one_small_change(parent_path)
if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_one_small_change(parent_path = parent_path) # Now add "thing 3" to the "bla" file # And amend the latest commit }

text: working feature branch . made many small commits figuring things . Now want commits tell story PR reviewers, story many stupid mistakes made! tool git base --interactive also available git rebase -. Useful links: https://jvns.ca/blog/2023/11/06/rebasing--can-go-wrong-/ https://wizardzines.com/comics/rules--rebasing/ https://github.com/MikeMcQuaid/GitInPractice/blob/main/06-RewritingHistoryAndDisasterRecovery.adoc#rebase-commits-interactively-git-rebase-interactive https://github.blog/developer-skills/github/write-better-commits-build-better-projects/

code: exo_rebase_i(parent_path)
if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_rebase_i(parent_path = parent_path) }

text: working feature branch . made many small commits figuring things . Now want commits tell story PR reviewers, story many stupid mistakes made! Instead git base --interactive also available git rebase -, can also use git reset --mixed build commits. Useful links: https://github.blog/developer-skills/github/write-better-commits-build-better-projects/ https://masalmon.eu/2024/06/11/rewrite-git-history/

code: exo_reset(parent_path)
if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_reset(parent_path = parent_path) }
exo_revert_file(parent_path)

text: git log, git restore, git checkout, git commit.

code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_revert_file(parent_path = parent_path) }

text: want find commit ID message HEAD~5 HEAD^^. tool git rev-parse combined git log git show. ancestry references: https://git-scm.com/book//v2/Git-Tools-Revision-Selection.html#_ancestry_references.

code: exo_revparse(parent_path)

text: git rev-parse, git log, git show.

code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_revparse(parent_path = parent_path) }

text: made many edits file, different places. much commit, since small commits best practice. need add changes Git bit bit. tool git add --patch, also available git add -p. changes presented one chunk git add --patch, choose "s" option splitting. See https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Git-Tools-Interactive-Staging#_staging_patches. Note patch also option git commit, prefer .

code: exo_split_changes(parent_path)
if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_split_changes(parent_path = parent_path) }
exo_time_machine(parent_path)
if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_time_machine(parent_path = parent_path) }
exo_undo_commit(parent_path)
if (FALSE) { # interactive() parent_path <- withr::local_tempdir() path <- exo_undo_commit(parent_path = parent_path) }

what: saperlipopette: Create Example Git Messes — saperlipopette-package
title: saperlipopette: Create Example Git Messes — saperlipopette-package
text: Holds functions creating Git messes, users solve, follow https://ohshitgit.com/.

title: saperlipopette: Create Example Git Messes — saperlipopette-package
text: Maintainer: Maëlle Salmon msmaellesalmon@gmail.com (ORCID) contributors: Jim Gardner [contributor]

title: saperlipopette (development version)
text: New exo_blame() exercise practice finding added specific line git blame. New exo_log_deleted_file() exercise practice finding deleted file git log -- <path>. New exo_log_deleted_line() exercise practice finding deleted line git log --S<string> git log --R<regex>. New exo_revparse() exercise practice parsing ancestry references git rev-parse. New exo_worktree() exercise practice git worktree. Add instructions “switch” “restore” alongside “checkout” equivalents (#30).

title: saperlipopette 0.1.0
text: Translation Spanish saperlipopette’s messages, Git commit messages (#25). Translation French saperlipopette’s messages, Git commit messages (#24). Initial set playgrounds.
